ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Techniques in molecular biology, such as PCR, qPCR, RT-PCR, gel electrophoresis, extracting and purifying RNA, hybridizing RNA, etc. In addition, it was valuable to learn how to conduct a large, multi-step experiment from start to finish throughout the entire course.
I learned how to do many important lab techniques in genetics/bio research.

I gained knowledge of molecular and developmental biology concepts such as gene expression and regeneration. I gained skills in laboratory and research techniques such as PCR, RNAi, Qiagen Plasmid Miniprep, etc. I gained insights into writing about my experiments in a scientific way.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Although scheduled from 1:30 to 5:30, the class finished as early as 3:00 and as late as 6:30. When some portions needed to be redone, this made our schedule tight toward the end of the term. The actual content was excellent, though it varies from year to year. Dr. Nelson is extremely knowledgeable and helpful, as were the TAs.

The course was really well developed for learning and was relatively stress-free, Professor Nelson was a really great leader and made sure we all knew what we were doing and explained everything well. He would even come in on weekends to redo experiments to make sure we were on track to finish.
dr. nelson is the biggest strength--extremely kind and patient.
Strengths of the course include organized procedures and laboratory protocols for the day and office hour time after the day's protocol.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely, especially if you need an MCDB lab.

Yes, it is a great way to fulfill the bio lab requirements. It is a relatively non-competitive environment and even though some day we had to stay really late, it was fun and we suffered through it together.
definitely! if you need a bio lab this is the course to take. email quickly in january though because it fills up fast.
Yes, this is a great half-semester course to learn laboratory techniques, study planaria regeneration, and practice writing a scientific report.

extras.title: MCDB 342L 01 - Laboratory in Nucleic Acids I
